required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Long-term Follow-up Study of Patients With MPS IIIA Treated With ABO-102
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-term Follow-up Study of Patients With MPS IIIA From Gene Therapy Clinical Trials Involving the Administration of ABO-102 (scAAV9.U1a.hSGSH)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, non-interventional, long-term follow-up study in participants from prior interventional trials involving the administration of ABO-102. Eligible participants will have up to 5 scheduled visits with assessments as specified in the schedule of assessments.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multicenter, noninterventional, long-term follow-up study of patients with MPS IIIA who have completed a prior clinical trial involving the administration of ABO-102. This study is designed to provide LTFU in accordance with the FDA and EMA guidelines for patients treated with gene therapy products. The duration of the current study is 3 years for a total of up to 5 years post-treatment for these participants who rollover from a prior clinical trial of ABO-102. Participants will have up to 5 scheduled visits with assessments as specified in the schedule of assessments.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence, type, and severity of Adverse Events (AEs)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mullen Scales of Early Learning or the Kaufman Assessment Battery for Children; Second Edition
secondary_outcome.description: Neurocognitive evolution based on developmental-age appropriate assessments included in the prior clinical trial.
Quality of life based on Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL™) applicable for participants who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Gastrointestinal Symptom
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life based on Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Gastrointestinal Symptom applicable for participants who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.
Quality of life based on Parenting Stress Index, 4th Edition (PSI-4) applicable for participants who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.

Quality of life based on sleep-pattern evaluation based on modified Children's Sleep Habits Questionnaire (CSHQ), applicable for participants who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.
Evolution on Parental Global Impression Score, applicable for patients who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.
Evolution of Clinical Global Impression Improvement Score applicable for patients who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.
Evolution on Parent Symptom Score Questionnaire applicable for patients who completed these evaluations in the prior clinical trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody formation (humoral) against the AAV9 capsid
secondary_outcome.description: Long-term immunological responses defined as antibody formation (humoral) and T-cell responses (cellular) against the AAV9 capsid.

secondary_outcome.measure: T-cell responses against the AAV9 capsid
secondary_outcome.description: Long-term immunological responses defined as T-cell responses against the AAV9 capsid.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody formation (humoral) against the N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase (SGSH) transgene product.
secondary_outcome.description: Long-term immunological responses defined as antibody formation (humoral) against the N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase (SGSH) transgene product.

secondary_outcome.measure: T-cell responses against the N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase (SGSH) transgene product.
secondary_outcome.description: Long-term immunological responses defined as T-cell responses against the N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase (SGSH) transgene product.
Long-term mentoring of viral load in those participants with positive results from previous trial.

arm_group.description: Participants from prior interventional trials involving the administration of ABO-102.

intervention.description: Study drug is not administered in this trial. Participants who received ABO-102 in a previous trial will be evaluated for long-term safety and efficacy.

study_pop.textblock: This long-term follow-up study will enroll up to 50 patients with MPS IIIA from prior ABO-102 clinical trials. Participants from the previous trials are of any racial, ethnic, or gender background, and could be in the early, middle or advanced phase of the disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants that have completed a prior clinical trial involving the administration of ABO-102.
- Parent(s)/legal guardian(s) of participant willing and able to complete the informed consent process and comply with study procedures and visit schedule.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Planned or current participation in another clinical trial that may confound the safety and efficacy evaluation of ABO-102 during the duration of this study.
- Any other situation that precludes the participant from undergoing procedures required in this study.
